body: [This thread](http://forum.lwjgl.org/index.php?topic=6872.0) on the LWJGL forum mentions some possible solutions.

And the StackOverflow answer linked from that looks quite practical for libGDX, though I'm not sure what exactly Runtime is in this situation. https://stackoverflow.com/a/28807079/786740 (The comments seem vital, `xdg-open` on Linux and `start` on Windows should be good options, especially since I don't like listing all known browsers or using a particular name of a particular DLL that might change in some Windows 10 update.)

issue.title: Fix LWJGL3Net#openURI on macOS & JDK >= 16
issue.body: This PR changes the method of opening URLs on macOS, since `FileManager.openURL(URI)` is deprecated and will be removed in JDK 17+. See #6542 for more information.

body:
> And the StackOverflow answer linked from that looks quite practical for libGDX, though I'm not sure what exactly Runtime is in this situation.

`Runtime.exec()` is a JRE system method which spawns a subprocess. It's equivalent to creating a new terminal then firing `open url://target.com`

My only concern is that we've observed macOS's GateKeeper being fussy when handling spawned processes like this. I'll have to test whether #6543 requests new permissions. We've seen issues where users can permanently deny an application a permission with no way to change that decision.

> https://stackoverflow.com/a/28807079/786740 (The comments seem vital, `xdg-open` on Linux and `start` on Windows should be good options, especially since I don't like listing all known browsers or using a particular name of a particular DLL that might change in some Windows 10 update.)

I don't think it's really necessary for Linux/Windows platforms. `Desktop.getDesktop()` doesn't break games there and we've never seen an issue with the JDK's determination that something is/isn't a desktop platform.
@crykn I'm not seeing any issues with gatekeeper, so once the security issue of #6543 has been resolved, this can be regarded as fixed.

issue.title: Fix LWJGL3Net#openURI on macOS & JDK >= 16 (#6543)
issue.body: * Fix LWJGL3Net#openURI on macOS & JDK >= 16; closes #6542.

issue.title: mumbleAutoLaunchOption argument crashes on MacOS

repository.name: fabric-mumblelink-mod
repository.description: A Fabric mod that connects to the MumbleLink plugin.

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
I installed the mod onto my server, and setup where users will automatically connect to my mumble server when connecting to my minecraft server... Except my friends who are on mac will crash because of how it handles auto launching. Their game will just freeze when it says "Joining world". So far this is only a mac issue, as I am running linux (Arch Linux), and my other friends who are using windows 10 are fine. This is his log (He had to kill his minecraft process as it was stuck):

issue.title: Update Lwjgl3Net.openURI
issue.body: Avoid usage of java.awt.Desktop on LWJGL3.
